page.title: 01KILKHAMPTON SOUTH
page.content: This block is part of an inland plateau around 150m above sea level but cut by two main river systems. {1.}The Lamberal Water- A shallow marshy valley to the east and {2.}The river Stratt-A deep wooded valley to the west of the block.None of the main village lies in this block with the exception of the Old Rectory now partly holiday accomodation,the Cornish Iron Foundry, also tourist orientated and the Lodge and grounds of Penstowe Manor excluding the manor itself.The remaining habitations are outlying farms.The main A39 trunk road passing through Bude and Bideford crosses the N.W. corner of the block. The B3254 runs through the centre of the block and is a busy second class road carrying a lot of local traffic to Holsworthy and Launceston
